328: :label: thm-total-error-bound

330: For any Lipschitz observable $\phi: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$ with constant $L_\phi$, the empirical average from the N-particle discrete-time Fragile Gas approximates the mean-field invariant measure with error:
331: 
332: $$
333: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \phi(z_i) \right] - \int_\Omega \phi(z) \rho_0(z) dz \right| \leq L_\phi \left( \frac{C_1}{\sqrt{N}} + C_2 \Delta t \right)
334: $$
335: 
336: where:
337: - $C_1 = C_1(\gamma, \sigma, \lambda, \alpha, \beta, \Omega)$: Particle number scaling (mean-field convergence)
338: - $C_2 = C_2(\gamma, \sigma, \lambda, \delta, \kappa_W, \|U\|_{C^4})$: Time discretization and cloning mechanism errors (both $O(\Delta t)$)
339: 
340: The constants can be computed explicitly from system parameters.
341: 
342: **Note**: The $O(\Delta t)$ term combines two sources:
